description.narrative: By 2017, the Multi-Sectoral Nutrition Plan, targeting the most vulnerable newborn, infant and young children, adolescents, especially girls, pregnant and lactating women, HIV affected children and women, and children and women with disabilities, has political commitment and sectoral budget allocation, which contributes to Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, national policies, legislation, plans, budgets, coordination and monitoring mechanisms are enabling the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents, and women, to be fulfilled with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, the Multi-Sectoral Nutrition Plan, targeting the most vulnerable newborn, infant and young children, adolescents,especially girls, pregnant and lactating women, HIV affected children and women, and children and women with disabilities, haspolitical commitment and sectoral budget allocation

description.narrative: National Planning Commission with technical and financial support of UNICEF finalized second phase, endorsed and costed Multi-sectoral Nutrition Plan (2018-2022) equivalent to USD 489 million.. The plan has been cleared by Ministry of Finance and approved by the Cabinet on 19th November 2017 and was launched on 14 Dec 2017. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: MIYCN strategy and costed plan in place, budget allocated and spent by MOHP

target.value: 2017:Available by 2013, with 100% implementation in priority districts by 2017

actual.value: 2017:Comprehensive Maternal, Infant and Young Child Nutrition (MIYCN) action plan finalized and endorsed by Ministry of Health. MIYCN strategy and costed plan available with budget allocation preparation in process; and now ongoing implementation in all 75 districts. approved by the Government.

title.narrative: Multi-Sectoral Nutrition Plan supported by a Multi-Sector Nutrition Information System adapted locally and implemented in normal and humanitarian situations

actual.value: 2017:Implementation of Multi-sectoral Nutrition Plan (MSNP) has been scaled up in 30 MSNP districts and ongoing implementation of both nutrition specific and sensitive interventions. The online reporting system in place in all 30 districts.

2017:Government of Nepal has allocated approx. US$ 189 million (US$ 17 million for nutrition sensitive and US$ 172 million for nutrition specific interventions) in the current fiscal year 2017/2018 nationwide. This is equivalent to 1.5% of the totqal national budget.
